intro: Scaevola revoluta subsp. stenostachya, commonly known as the narrow-stemmed fanflower, is a perennial shrub native to Australia. It features compact, rounded foliage and produces clusters of bright blue or violet flowers. The plant has a prostrate to ascending growth habit, often forming dense mats. It thrives in well-drained soils and is drought-tolerant, making it suitable for coastal and sandy environments. Its flowers are typically borne on short pedicels, adding a decorative touch to gardens and natural landscapes.
